title: What one sees is not always reality
content: I am not usually a mystery reader. But this book drew me in immediately. The main characters seem to have nothing in common. Millie has just gotten out of prison and looking for a job. She ends up being hired by Nina,who lives in a mansion and has a young daughter and a rich and hàndsome husband. At first Millie is happy to be living in a small drab room in the attic.  Nina is proving to be hard to please and her young daughter is down right spoiled. Then Andrew her husband seems like the answer to Millie's problems. Then the tables get turned and Millie becomes an answer to Nina's unhappy marriage.Lots of twist to plot that will keep you reading to the satisfying resolution.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The Housemaid by Frieda McFadden is a captivating psychological thriller that kept me on the edge of my seat from beginning to end. With its intricate plot twists and well-developed characters, this book is a must-read for fans of suspenseful fiction.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024

title: A Thrilling Psychological Journey
content: McFadden masterfully weaves a tale of intrigue and deceit, drawing the reader into a world of secrets and lies. The psychological depth of the characters is impressive, making it easy to empathize with their struggles and motivations. The author's ability to maintain suspense throughout the narrative is truly commendable.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: While I can't reveal too much about the plot without spoiling the surprises, I can say that the ending is both satisfying and unexpected. It leaves you wanting more and eager to dive into the next book in the series.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024

title: Never have I ever!
content: If you enjoy a thrilling read with plenty of twists and turns, The Housemaid is definitely worth your time.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Never have I ever not been able to put down a book! This is the first book that I could not get enough of! Because of a traumatic brain injury I have a difficulty reading sometimes but I still usually read deep and difficult books. And rice books per se. But I decided to take a break from my typical book style and read this since it has been advertised to me relentlessly. And here we are just thrilled and ready to purchase the next! Read THIS NOW!! As someone who has been through abuse by someone who I believe showed or has been diagnosed as a narcissist... This book had its moments but I'm not so weak that I couldn't go on. I had to find out what was going to happen!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: 3 out 5 at the beginning but a 5 out of 5 ending!
content: I highly recommend going into this book blindly! I would have never picked it up if I didn’t. I would give this five stars but couldn’t because I caught on pretty quickly of the main twist. I did end up liking the book and loved the ending. Which is why I still rate it high even though I just couldn’t give it five but it has such an amazing the ending. Most all characters got the ending they deserved! And it shows light of how easy it is to get swept into this kind of situation.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is the second book by Freida McFadden I have read. This one was so good I finished it in less than 24 hours. I would have stayed up all night to read it if I didn’t have to work the next day lol. I don’t typically read psychological thrillers, but THIS ONE was so good I could barely put it down. Perfect suspenseful vibe, crazy twists you would never guess, and great characters. I’ll be starting the 2nd book in the series immediately.
